name: soloing
content:
soloing noun [U]
(MUSIC)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the activity of playing a musical instrument or singing on your own, or with only backing music: Jazz fans got a lot of soloing. He did some brilliantfantastic soloing, in which his training as a classical musician was evident.
More examplesFewer examplesThe album features some of the best guitar soloing I have ever heard.The concert's most poignant moments came during the extended soloing.Some of their soloing lacks the flow and swing that makes you want to snap your fingers.

soloing noun [U]
(CLIMBING)
(also solo climbing) a type of rock climbing in which someone climbs alone, usually without any safety equipment: The most high-risk form of rock climbing is soloing. He had a brush with death on a solo climbing expedition in Utah when a half-ton rock fell on him. Compare
bouldering
More examplesFewer examplesAfter we got bored of swimming and soloing, we headed off to the Freezer, a steep sport climbing crag in the nearby area.The cult of solo climbing resulted in a number of early fatalities.
